snippet.title: 3  The Cost of Weak Definitions of Done
snippet.description:
💸 The Cost of Weak Definitions of Done
🎥 Episode 3 of 10 — Now Live

📍 Every shortcut adds interest to your technical debt.
📍 Every time you skip a quality check, or fudge what “done” means...
You're not saving time—you’re scheduling future pain.

A weak Definition of Done leads to:
⚠️ Unusable increments
⚠️ Production risks
⚠️ Missed insights
⚠️ Eroded trust
If you can’t trust what your team shipped, it’s not really done—it’s just delayed failure.

💡 At NKD Agility, we help teams tighten up their Definition of Done:
✅ Enforceable standards
✅ Evidence-based validation
✅ Delivery that meets real strategic goals
Because weak delivery isn’t about missing features—
It’s about missing outcomes, feedback, and trust.

📈 Want to stop paying the hidden costs of weak delivery? Visit https://www.nkdagility.com 

👇 Tap to watch now. Follow for the full 10-part series.
#DefinitionOfDone #TechnicalDebt #SoftwareQuality #AgileDelivery #EngineeringExcellence #NKDAgility #MartinHinshelwood #ValueDrivenDevelopment #RedefiningDone #ProductOutcomes
